ctpMetaData.bhstData:
There are 190 MBA colleges in Mumbai that offer MBA courses. Among them, 137 MBA colleges are privately owned and 11 MBA colleges are owned by the public/government organisations. CAT, XAT, and CMAT are the most accepting entrance exams in best MBA colleges in Mumbai. National Institute of Industrial Engineering, IIT Bombay, and SPJIMR are the most famous MBA institutes in Mumbai.

The revised position for some of the top MBA college in Mumbai is mentioned below:

  • National Institute of Industrial Engineering improved its ranking as it shifted to rank 7 in 2023 when as compared to rank 9 in 2022.
  • S. P. Jain Institute of Management & Research improved its ranking as it shifted to rank 20 in 2023 when as compared to rank 21 in 2022.

Latest Updates:

  • The XAT 2024 registration last date has been extended till Dec 10, 2023. Further, XAT 2024 admit card will be released on Dec 20, 2023 and the exam is scheduled for Jan 7, 2024. 
  • CAT exam 2023 was held on November 26, 2023. Registered candidates can download the official answer key from the IIMCAT website.
  • KMAT 2023 result is likely to be announced in the month of December 2023. Candidates who appeared for the KMAT Karnataka exam 2023 can check their results online.

Best MBA Colleges in Mumbai (All): Highlights 2023

MBA is one of the most popular post-graduate programs in Hyderabad. The two-year program is a gateway to a plethora of job opportunities in the corporate world. Students from any background, including Science, Commerce, and Humanities can pursue MBA. Such students should also possess important skills such as excellent communication, leadership, problem-solving, management, research-oriented, strong mathematical skills, etc.

Check out the key highlights of the MBA colleges Mumbai colleges below:

Particulars

Parameters

No. of Colleges

190

Annual Fees

INR < 1 lakh: 3 colleges

INR 1-2 lakh: 15 colleges

INR 2-3 lakh: 25 colleges

INR 3-5 lakh: 30 colleges

INR > 5 lakh: 82 colleges

Top Specialisations

Finance, Sales & Marketing, HR, BA, etc.

Accepted Entrance Exams

CAT, MAT, XAT, CMAT, etc.

Predict your chances here: MBA 2023 Cutoff Predictor

How can I get admission to top MBA colleges in Mumbai?

The eligibility criteria for the MBA courses may differ from college to college. However, the basic eligibility criteria for top MBA college in Mumbai are as follows:

  • Candidates must have passed graduation in any discipline or equivalent from a recognised university as some basic eligibility criteria for MBA (full-time).
  • Most of the institutes follow the minimum score criteria for graduation which is 50 percent on average or equivalent. For reserved category students, the minimum score is 45 percent in aggregate.
  • Final-year graduation candidates are also eligible to apply for MBA, provided they present the proof of completion of graduation degree within the duration specified by the institute.

What are the entrance exams for MBA colleges in Mumbai (All)?

The two most popular entrance exams accepted in MBA College in Mumbai are:

  • XAT: XAT (Xavier Aptitude Test) is a national-level management entrance examination conducted by XLRI, Jamshedpur for admission to MBA/PGDM programmes. XAT preparation needs at least six to nine months. Being one of the tougher MBA entrance exams among its peers, XAT requires dedicated time and effort.
  • CAT: Common Admission Test (CAT) is a national level management aptitude test for admission to the MBA courses offered by 20 IIMs and over 1,200 B-schools in India. CAT question paper is divided into three sections: Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension, Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning and Quantitative Aptitude. The preparation for CAT exam should include phase wise completion of the CAT syllabus, mock test practice and revision.
  • MAT: Management Aptitude Test or MAT is a national-level entrance exam conducted by the All India Management Association (AIMA) for admissions to MBA/PGDM courses. The exam is conducted in multiple sessions in four phases – February, May, September and December. MAT exam is conducted in offline (Paper Based Test or PBT), online (Computer Based Test or CBT) and remote proctored (Internet Based Test or IBT) modes.

Listed below are the following admission dates for Mumbai MBA colleges:

What are the entrance exams accepted by MBA Colleges in Mumbai?

The most popular entrance examinations for studying MBA courses in Mumbai are CAT and MAT. There are some other exams as well that are accepted by the MBA colleges in Mumbai, such as XAT, CMAT, ATMA, MAH CET, NMAT, MHT CET, etc. for admission into their colleges.

What is the Average Fee of Best MBA Colleges in Mumbai (All)?

Return on Investment (ROI) shows how much profit or benefit you get if you pursue a course from a particular college. It assesses the return of the fee invested by the candidate while studying and the return he/she gets in the form of placements.

Mumbai is the best destination for the placement package students get after completion of the course. Mumbai has many colleges which gave the best placements. Refer to the table below to know the best MBA fees in Mumbai and average placement package:

mainEntity.name: How many MBA colleges are there in Mumbai (All)?

acceptedAnswer.text: In Mumbai, there are 190 MBA institutes that provide MBA programmes. There are 137 MBA institutions that are privately held among them, and 11 MBA colleges that are owned by public or government entities. The leading MBA colleges in Mumbai accept candidates from CAT, XAT, and CMAT as their entrance exams. The three most well-known MBA programmes in Mumbai are SPJIMR, IIT Bombay, and National Institute of Industrial Engineering.

mainEntity.name: What are the top MBA colleges in Mumbai with low fees?

acceptedAnswer.text:
There are 3 colleges with annual fees INR <1 lakh. Moving up the fee range, there are 15 colleges with fees ranging from INR 1-2 lakh. In the INR 2-3 Lacs bracket, there are 25 MBA colleges. For those willing to invest between INR 3-5 Lacs annually, there are 30 colleges to choose from. If you have a more substantial budget of over INR 5 lakh, you'll find a wider selection, with 82 colleges offering their programmes at this price point. Refer to the table below for a detailed overview of the top MBA colleges in Mumbai having less fees of INR <1 lakh:
College Name Total Tuition Fee Indian Institute of Materials Management INR 81,000 Imarticus Learning INR 90,000 Welingkar Mumbai INR 94,000

mainEntity.name: Which are the top five colleges in Mumbai to pursue MBA?

acceptedAnswer.text: Every year, colleges are ranked by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF). The rating is determined by a number of factors, and it varies from year to year based on how well a college or university performs in areas like faculty, placements, and infrastructure. The table below includes the NIRF rankings for the Mumbai MBA colleges for the years 2021 to 2023. College Name NIRF 2021 NIRF 2022 NIRF 2023 IIM Mumbai (formerly known as NITIE) 12 9 7 IIT Bombay 10 11 10 SPJIMR 19 21 20 NMIMS 22 25 21 KJ Somaiya Institute of Management 56 71 45

mainEntity.name: When should I start preparing for MBA entrance exam?

acceptedAnswer.text: In the final year of graduation, preparation for an MBA begins. The majority of management aspirants begin their preparation as soon as they begin their third year of their bachelor's degree programme because it takes months to properly prepare for MBA entrance exams. However, there are a lot of challenges in preparing for an MBA entrance exam, including the lengthy syllabus, the difficulty of the questions, and the degree of competition. Here are some suggestions to help you study for your MBA entrance exams: Study the fundamental grammatical and writing principles for the verbal segment to become familiar with the language's structure. To hone their quantitative abilities, students should complete a lot of practice exams and sample papers. Create a schedule and follow it Students should not overstress themselves and should get enough rest.

mainEntity.name: What is the tuition fees of top MBA colleges in Mumbai (All)?

acceptedAnswer.text: SPJIMR and NMIMS have the highest total tuition fees within the range of INR 20 lakh to INR 22 lakh and INR 13 lakh to INR 24 lakh, while Welingkar Mumbai charges the lowest tuition fees within the range of INR 94,000 to INR 13 lakh. For information on the typical total tuition fee, see the table below: College Name Total Tuition Fee IIT Bombay INR 8 Lacs - INR 20 lakh IIM Mumbai (formerly known as NITIE) INR 9 lakh SPJIMR INR 20 Lacs - INR 22 lakh NMIMS INR 13 Lacs - INR 24 lakh Welingkar Institute of Management INR 94,000 - INR 13 lakh READ MORE: MBA Admissions 2024

acceptedAnswer.text: IIM Mumbai offered the highest average annual placement package, ranging from INR 21 LPA to INR 31 LPA, while the Welingkar Institute of Management, Mumbai offered the lowest average placement package of INR 11 LPA. Below is the list of MBA Colleges in Mumbai along with their average package and list of prominent recruiters: College Name Average Package Top Recruiters IIM Mumbai (formerly known as NITIE) Placements INR 21 Lacs - INR 31 LPA Google, Amazon, HUL, ITC, Nestle, Mondelez, Marico, JnJ, General Electric IIT Bombay Placements INR 26.64 LPA Microsoft, Google, TCS, Infosys, Apple, Tech Mahindra, Cognizant SPJIMR Placements INR 21 LPA - INR 31 LPA TCS, Deloitte, Accenture Strategy, Mahindra, GMC, HUL, P&G. NMIMS Placements INR 19 LPA Goldman Sachs, Pidilite, Marico, Dabur, Asian Paints, ITC. Welingkar Institute of Management Placements INR 11 LPA Reliance brands, KPMG, Wipro, Morgan Stanley, Motilal Oswal

mainEntity.name: How to prepare for CAT exam?

acceptedAnswer.text: A well-balanced approach is essential for success in the CAT exam, aspirants must be aware. Six to eight hours of daily study time must be included in the CAT 2023 preparation schedule. Working professionals must set aside at least four hours each day and eight hours on weekends for preparation. You must concentrate on the most crucial subjects that will help you earn good marks during the last stage of exam preparation. See the generic CAT exam preparation technique listed below, which any applicant can use to create a comprehensive study schedule. Step 1: Carefully review the CAT 2023 syllabus and comprehend the CAT exam pattern 2023. Step 2: Obtain CAT books and other suggested literature. Step 3: Join online MBA study groups on sites like Facebook, WhatsApp, Quora, YouTube, and Telegram. Step 4: Create a monthly schedule, a weekly schedule, and a daily schedule. Step 5: For the best outcomes, follow the timetable and preparation plan for the CAT. To Read More: How to prepare for CAT entrance exam?

Yes, the difficulty level of CAT syllabus is very high as compared to other MBA entrance exams. However, if you prepare well and follow the CAT exam pattern well, you will be able to score well. Besides having an understanding of the CAT syllabus 2023, candidates also need to be well aware of the CAT exam pattern before they start preparing for the exam. The CAT exam pattern was revised in 2021 and the number of questions were reduced from 76 to 66. The structure of CAT 2022 exam was the same. The syllabus is still tougher than other exams. The most important things to keep in mind are: CAT exam mode is online Each question carries three marks There is negative marking of minus one mark for wrong attempts The section-wise distribution of questions and difficulty levels as per the latest CAT exam pattern are listed below: Quantitative Ability (QA) - 24 questions, difficulty level - moderate to high Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning (DILR) - 20 questions, difficulty level - moderate Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension (VARC) - 22 questions, difficulty level - moderate. to high

mainEntity.name: What job profiles are available to students after completing an MBA degree?

acceptedAnswer.text: The top MBA specialisations that typically result in the highest salaries after graduation are finance, marketing, general management, business analytics, and entrepreneurship. Following an MBA, the highest-paying jobs in India range in salary from INR 5 to 30 LPA. Following are some of the well-liked post-MBA career possibilities and their associated salaries: MBA job profiles Average salary (INR) Finance Manager 9.6 LPA Marketing Manager 10 LPA Sales Manager 10 LPA Human Resources Manager 4 LPA Operations Manager 7 LPA Product Manager 15 LPA Data Analytics Manager 14 LPA Digital Marketing Manager 4.5 LPA NGO Manager 5 LPA Also Read: List of MBA Specialisations: Which one to Choose?

mainEntity.name: Can I do MBA without giving any entrance exam?

acceptedAnswer.text: In rare circumstances, it is possible to pursue an MBA without taking any entrance exam. The CAT, MAT, GMAT, XAT, and other standardized entrance exams are required for admission to many MBA programs worldwide. If you are not planning to take the CAT in 2023, listed below are some direct admission eligibility criteria to help you be accepted into MBA programs. The minimum score required in the UG level examination may differ from one college to another, however, the student must have scored at least 50%-65% aggregate in his or her graduation. For the reserved category, the score should at least be 45% aggregate. Some institutes accept other competitive exam scores such as XAT, MAT, GMAT, NMAT, ATMA, SNAP, etc. READ MORE: Best MBA Colleges without CAT Exam If you did not appear for the CAT exam and still wish to get admission to the best MBA colleges in India without CAT, then, here is a list of top MBA institutes that give admissions based on different entrance criteria or exams. MBA Colleges/ Institutes MBA Exam Score Accepted SIBM, Pune SNAP XLRI, Jamshedpur XAT Xavier University, Bhubaneshwar XAT, X-GMT Indian School of Business, Hyderabad GMAT Amity University XAT/GMAT/MAT/CAT/NMAT

ctp_tuple_6.answerText:
Yes, the difficulty level of CAT syllabus is very high as compared to other MBA entrance exams. However, if you prepare well and follow the CAT exam pattern well, you will be able to score well. Besides having an understanding of the CAT syllabus 2023, candidates also need to be well aware of the CAT exam pattern before they start preparing for the exam. The CAT exam pattern was revised in 2021 and the number of questions were reduced from 76 to 66. The structure of CAT 2022 exam was the same. The syllabus is still tougher than other exams.

The most important things to keep in mind are:

  1. CAT exam mode is online
  2. Each question carries three marks 
  3. There is negative marking of minus one mark for wrong attempts

The section-wise distribution of questions and difficulty levels as per the latest CAT exam pattern are listed below:

  • Quantitative Ability (QA) - 24 questions, difficulty level - moderate to high 
  • Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning (DILR) - 20 questions, difficulty level - moderate 
  • Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension (VARC) - 22 questions, difficulty level - moderate. to high

ctp_tuple_6.questionText: What job profiles are available to students after completing an MBA degree?
ctp_tuple_6.answerText:
The top MBA specialisations that typically result in the highest salaries after graduation are finance, marketing, general management, business analytics, and entrepreneurship. Following an MBA, the highest-paying jobs in India range in salary from INR 5 to 30 LPA. Following are some of the well-liked post-MBA career possibilities and their associated salaries:

MBA job profiles

Average salary (INR)

Finance Manager

9.6 LPA

Marketing Manager

10 LPA

Sales Manager

10 LPA

Human Resources Manager

4 LPA

Operations Manager

7 LPA

Product Manager

15 LPA

Data Analytics Manager

14 LPA

Digital Marketing Manager

4.5 LPA

NGO Manager

5 LPA

Also Read: List of MBA Specialisations: Which one to Choose?

ctp_tuple_6.questionText: Can I do MBA without giving any entrance exam?
ctp_tuple_6.answerText:
In rare circumstances, it is possible to pursue an MBA without taking any entrance exam. The CAT, MAT, GMAT, XAT, and other standardized entrance exams are required for admission to many MBA programs worldwide. 

If you are not planning to take the CAT in 2023, listed below are some direct admission eligibility criteria to help you be accepted into MBA programs.

  • The minimum score required in the UG level examination may differ from one college to another, however, the student must have scored at least 50%-65% aggregate in his or her graduation.
  • For the reserved category, the score should at least be 45% aggregate.
  • Some institutes accept other competitive exam scores such as XAT, MAT, GMAT, NMAT, ATMA, SNAP, etc.

READ MORE: Best MBA Colleges without CAT Exam

If you did not appear for the CAT exam and still wish to get admission to the best MBA colleges in India without CAT, then, here is a list of top MBA institutes that give admissions based on different entrance criteria or exams.

MBA Colleges/ Institutes

MBA Exam Score Accepted

Xavier University, Bhubaneshwar

ctp_tuple_4.questionText: What is the tuition fees of top MBA colleges in Mumbai (All)?
ctp_tuple_4.answerText:
SPJIMR and NMIMS have the highest total tuition fees within the range of INR 20 lakh to INR 22 lakh and INR 13 lakh to INR 24 lakh, while Welingkar Mumbai charges the lowest tuition fees within the range of INR 94,000 to INR 13 lakh.

For information on the typical total tuition fee, see the table below:

ctp_tuple_4.questionText: What is the placement package offered to MBA graduates from top MBA colleges in Mumbai (All)?
ctp_tuple_4.answerText:
IIM Mumbai offered the highest average annual placement package, ranging from INR 21 LPA to INR 31 LPA, while the Welingkar Institute of Management, Mumbai offered the lowest average placement package of INR 11 LPA.

ctp_tuple_4.questionText: How to prepare for CAT exam?
ctp_tuple_4.answerText:
A well-balanced approach is essential for success in the CAT exam, aspirants must be aware. Six to eight hours of daily study time must be included in the CAT 2023 preparation schedule. Working professionals must set aside at least four hours each day and eight hours on weekends for preparation. You must concentrate on the most crucial subjects that will help you earn good marks during the last stage of exam preparation. See the generic CAT exam preparation technique listed below, which any applicant can use to create a comprehensive study schedule.

Step 1: Carefully review the CAT 2023 syllabus and comprehend the CAT exam pattern 2023.

Step 2: Obtain  CAT books and other suggested literature.

Step 3: Join online MBA study groups on sites like Facebook, WhatsApp, Quora, YouTube, and Telegram.

Step 4: Create a monthly schedule, a weekly schedule, and a daily schedule.

Step 5: For the best outcomes, follow the timetable and preparation plan for the CAT.

To Read More: How to prepare for CAT entrance exam?

ctp_tuple_3.questionText: How many MBA colleges are there in Mumbai (All)?
ctp_tuple_3.answerText: In Mumbai, there are 190 MBA institutes that provide MBA programmes. There are 137 MBA institutions that are privately held among them, and 11 MBA colleges that are owned by public or government entities. The leading MBA colleges in Mumbai accept candidates from CAT, XAT, and CMAT as their entrance exams. The three most well-known MBA programmes in Mumbai are SPJIMR, IIT Bombay, and National Institute of Industrial Engineering.

ctp_tuple_3.questionText: What are the top MBA colleges in Mumbai with low fees?
ctp_tuple_3.answerText:
There are 3 colleges with annual fees INR <1 lakh. Moving up the fee range, there are 15 colleges with fees ranging from INR 1-2 lakh. In the INR 2-3 Lacs bracket, there are 25 MBA colleges. For those willing to invest between INR 3-5 Lacs annually, there are 30 colleges to choose from. If you have a more substantial budget of over INR 5 lakh, you'll find a wider selection, with 82 colleges offering their programmes at this price point.

Refer to the table below for a detailed overview of the top MBA colleges in Mumbai having less fees of INR <1 lakh:

ctp_tuple_3.questionText: When should I start preparing for MBA entrance exam?
ctp_tuple_3.answerText:
In the final year of graduation, preparation for an MBA begins. The majority of management aspirants begin their preparation as soon as they begin their third year of their bachelor's degree programme because it takes months to properly prepare for MBA entrance exams. However, there are a lot of challenges in preparing for an MBA entrance exam, including the lengthy syllabus, the difficulty of the questions, and the degree of competition. 

Here are some suggestions to help you study for your MBA entrance exams:

  • Study the fundamental grammatical and writing principles for the verbal segment to become familiar with the language's structure.
  • To hone their quantitative abilities, students should complete a lot of practice exams and sample papers.
    Create a schedule and follow it
  • Students should not overstress themselves and should get enough rest.
